official-title.#text: To end the practice of including more than one subject in a single bill by requiring that each bill enacted by Congress be limited to only one subject, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: One Subject at a Time Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
Each bill or joint resolution shall embrace no more than one subject.
The subject of a bill or joint resolution shall be clearly and descriptively expressed in the title.

An appropriations bill shall not contain any general legislation or change of existing law provision, the subject of which is not germane to the subject matter of each such appropriations bill provided however, that this section shall not be construed to prohibit any provision imposing limitations upon the expenditure of funds so appropriated.
If the title of an Act or joint resolution addresses two or more unrelated subjects, then the entire Act or joint resolution is void.

If the title of an Act or joint resolution addresses a single subject, but the Act contains one or more provisions concerning a subject that is not clearly and descriptively expressed in its title, then only such provision or provisions concerning the subject not clearly and descriptively expressed in the title shall be void.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on Appropriations of the House

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and therefore outside the subject of the bill, then such provision shall be void.

text.#text: If an Act appropriating funds contains a provision outside of the jurisdiction of the relevant subcommittee of the
If an Act appropriating funds contains general legislation or change of existing law provision not germane to the subject matter of such bill, then each and every such provision shall be void.

header.#text: Provisions of appropriation bills not germane to subject matter

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or this section, or any Member of Congress aggrieved by the failure of the House of Congress which that individual is a member to comply with any requirement of those sections, shall, regardless of the amount in controversy, have a cause of action under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: One Subject at a Time Act/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , against the United States to seek appropriate relief, including an injunction against the enforcement of any law, the passage of which did not conform to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: One Subject at a Time Act/s:2

text.#text: Any person aggrieved by the enforcement of, or attempt or threat of enforcement of, an Act passed without having complied with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the standard of review shall be de novo.
